snippet: The announcement by Secretary of State John Kerry and the Russian foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, set the stage for one of the most challenging undertakings in the history of arms control.
abstract: United States and Russia reach sweeping agreement that calls for Syria's arsenal of chemical weapons to be removed or destroyed by middle of 2014 and indefinitely stalls prospect of American airstrikes; joint announcement by Secretary of State John Kerry and Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov sets the stage for one of the most challenging undertakings in the history of arms control.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The announcement by Secretary of State John Kerry and the Russian foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, set the stage for one of the most challenging undertakings in the history of arms control.

headline.main: U.S. and Russia Reach Deal to Destroy Syria’s Chemical Arms
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Russia Reach A Deal on Dismantling Syria’s Chemical Arms
